dict.acceptation: 赞赏；称赞；欣赏；<美口>想要；

sent.orig: Many people admire Nixom, and Nixon is happy that there are people who admire him.
sent.trans: 许多人赞美尼克松，并且尼克松由于有人赞美他而感到高兴。

sent.orig: We always like those who admire us; we do not always likethose whom we admire.
sent.trans: 我们总是喜欢崇敬我们的人，但并不永远喜欢我们所崇敬的人。

sent.orig: They don't admire his new technique greatly, but they admire it to some extent.
sent.trans: 他们虽不十分佩服他的新技术，但还是多少有点服气。

sent.orig: We always love those who admire us; we do not always love those whom we admire.
sent.trans: 我们永远爱那些称赞我们的人；我们不会永远爱那些我们称赞的人。

sent.orig: There is a scalpel is not only to admire the money-saving angels in white.
sent.trans: 有一把手术刀不慕金钱只救死扶伤的白衣天使。
